item.title: Stacey add a quote by Stacia Kane
item.description:
"Readers have the right to say whatever the fuck they want about a book. Period. They have that right. If they hate the book because the MC says the word “delicious” and the reader believes it’s the Devil’s word and only evil people use it, they can shout from the rooftops “This book is shit and don’t read it” if they want. If they want to write a review entirely about how much they hate the cover, they can if they want. If they want to make their review all about how their dog Foot Foot especially loved to pee on that particular book, they can."
[<a href="http://www.staciakane.net/2012/01/09/something-in-the-water/">Blog entry, January 9, 2012</a>]" -- Stacia Kane

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Sane and intelligent human beings are like all other human beings, and carefully and cautiously and diligently conceal their private real opinions from the world and give out fictitious ones in their stead for general consumption." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description:
"There are, it has been said, two types of people in the world. There are those who, when presented with a glass that is exactly half full, say: this glass is half full. And then there are those who say: this glass is half empty.
The world belongs, however, to those who can look at the glass and say: What's up with this glass? Excuse me? Excuse me? This is my glass? I don't think so. My glass was full! And it was a bigger glass! Who's been pinching my beer?" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stacey add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Religion has convinced people that there's an invisible man ... living in the sky. Who watches everything you do every minute of every day. And the invisible man has a list of ten specific things he doesn't want you to do. And if you do any of these things, he will send you to a special place, of burning and fire and smoke and torture and anguish for you to live forever, and suffer, and suffer, and burn, and scream, until the end of time. But he loves you. He loves you. He loves you and he needs money." -- George Carlin

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "Anyone who knew the word slattern was worth cultivating as a friend." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Stacey add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "I am not going to get into it myself, except to say (1) if I am writing "boy fiction," who are all those boys with breasts who keep turning up by the hundreds at my signings and readings? and (2) thank you, geek girls! I love you all." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There is a rumour going around that I have found God. I think this is unlikely because I have enough difficulty finding my keys, and there is empirical evidence that they exist." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Cheris Kramarae
item.description: "Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings." -- Cheris Kramarae

item.title: Stacey add a quote by bh
item.description: "I am passionate about everything in my life--first and foremost, passionate about ideas. And that's a dangerous person to be in this society, not just because I'm a woman, but because it's such a fundamentally anti-intellectual, anti-critical thinking society. --bell hooks" -- bh

item.title: Stacey add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "...[T]he only means I have to stop ignorant snobs from behaving towards genre fiction with snobbish ignorance is to not reinforce their ignorance and snobbery by lying and saying that when I write SF it isn't SF, but to tell them more or less patiently for forty or fifty years that they are wrong to exclude SF and fantasy from literature, and proving my arguments by writing well." -- Ursula K. Le Guin
